paper_abstract: We study the problem of covering a word f by a set F of available segments. In particular we demonstrate that each F induces a unique structure (scaffold) on f which determines how all "succint" coverings of f (by elements of F) are positioned on f. Our motivation for this study comes from the formalization of the template-guided recombination which is a molecular operation that provides a solution for a molecular implementation of gene assembly in ciliates.
